page.title: 18Easton Farm, Boynton.
page.content: Easton Farm has 392 acres of land. It has 117 acres of winter barley, 28 acres of potatoes, 91 acres of spring barley, 6 acres of swedes and 132.1/2 acres of winter wheat. The farm has 4 tractors, all Fordsons. They have 2 combines, a Claas and a Clayson.They have an oil-fired corn dryer that dries 4 tons an hour. The old chalk house is 225 years old. It used to have a pantile roof. Now it is lived in by a farm worker. A new house was built in 1938. They have a new shed that was built in 1983. It is made of steel and it has asbestos sheeting on the roof. They spray most of their crops by aeroplane. They have one full-time worker. Their only animals are 4 sheep to keep the garden tidy.
